### Exploratory data analysis

It is important prior to stating any analysis to inspect data. This can be done to check for any departures from normality or any existing trend. Principle plots like histogram, boxplots and kurtosis can help detect distributions of data that deviates from the normality. In additions maps can aid illustrate any spatial trends.


```{r t1}
d <- read.csv("soil_data_CIAT.csv", stringsAsFactors=FALSE)
head(d, n=3)
```

Examine the spatial trend of pH by using regression on coordinates
```{r t2}
trend <- lm(Clay~X+Y, d) 
summary(trend)

```
